alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 12:11PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Osage River at Taberville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 27.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM CDT Sunday was 27.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 24.1 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 10/17/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this afternoon at 115 PM CDT.
